comment.author: 55597723@N02
comment._content: Nice Photo during my early High School Days. Nice looking Gentleman. I have worked in Warehouses in my past in my Land, but I know that RR work is really a hard job - - -

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Wrong spot NLI, it should be in the small triangle between Roxboro Road (R311) and the railway linesjust above Careys Road/Roxboro Road junction.  It was known locally as the "Loco" and they were the works where Mr. Hempenstall operated.  The entrance was on the south side of the bridge over the lines just to the right of Careys Road!  A little further out is the church for Janesboro and just after that the Garda Station.  Careys Road is known in Limerick as the "Yellow Road" and is the place where my glyph originated as the "Cookies" came from there.  Many of the people who formed and played for that club down through the years worked in the 'Loco!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Tah Dah! How's that now? Had always wondered about the Cookies bit. And the Swords?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: No! To the right of Roxboro Road within the triangle created by the railway line and Roxboro! Just below the right hand corner of the R311 box as it is now! Swords comes from the razor sharp wit???  Only messing, I'm a cookie in exile in North County Dublin!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Right! Sleeves rolled up as I hoosh poor Dan Hempenstall once again, he's starting to get a bit grumpy. Can't get any work done with all this Relocation, Relocation, Relocation... How's that, Witty Exiled Cookie?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Right now Dan the Man is home where he belongs.  I should delete all my miserable attempts at giving directions but that would be re-writing history and theres enough of that around!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Oh don't delete anything! I want everyone to know how I suffer for my art...  :D  And thank you, knew we'd (I'd) get there in the end!
